availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Blake (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and pvt 40th KY Mtd Inf & 4th KY Mtg Inf USA)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Bourbon County native. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1863. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 29, 1863, to January 28, 1864. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from March 24, 1864. Reported as deserted from Nashville, Tennessee, on June 5, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 439.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0178.
